results.title: The Golden Globes Were Too Big to Fail
results.abstract: Did the awards get their legitimacy back? You can’t regain what you never had.

multimedia.caption: In his Golden Globes monologue, the host Jerrod Carmichael wrestled with his own complicity in legitimizing the awards.
In his Golden Globes monologue, the host Jerrod Carmichael wrestled with his own complicity in legitimizing the awards.
In his Golden Globes monologue, the host Jerrod Carmichael wrestled with his own complicity in legitimizing the awards.

results.title: Tarnished Golden Globes Return to TV, and Hollywood Plays Along
results.abstract: Amid a few awkward moments, the industry’s stars mostly embraced the chance to accept film and TV trophies in hopes of a bump in business and award-season momentum.

multimedia.caption: The stand-up comedian Jerrod Carmichael hosted the ceremony, often poking at its troubles.
The stand-up comedian Jerrod Carmichael hosted the ceremony, often poking at its troubles.
The stand-up comedian Jerrod Carmichael hosted the ceremony, often poking at its troubles.

results.title: Golden Globes Winners 2023: The Complete List
results.abstract: The winning films, TV shows, actors and production teams at the 2023 Golden Globe Awards.

multimedia.caption: Michelle Yeoh accepting her Golden Globe.
Michelle Yeoh accepting her Golden Globe.
Michelle Yeoh accepting her Golden Globe.

results.title: Is Stephanie Hsu the ‘Dark Horse’ of Award Season?
results.abstract: The “Everything Everywhere All at Once” actress may not be as well known as her co-stars, but her role is crucial enough to deserve consideration.

multimedia.caption: “This industry is weird,” Stephanie Hsu said. There are moments when a famous actor congratulates you and “moments where you walk on a carpet and people are like, ‘Lana Condor, Lana Condor!’”
multimedia.copyright: Ryan Pfluger for The New York Times

multimedia.caption: “This industry is weird,” Stephanie Hsu said. There are moments when a famous actor congratulates you and “moments where you walk on a carpet and people are like, ‘Lana Condor, Lana Condor!’”

results.title: Steven Spielberg Gets a Record 13th Directors Guild Award Nomination
results.abstract: The all-male list omitted major contenders this season like James Cameron, Baz Luhrmann, Sarah Polley and Gina Prince-Bythewood.

multimedia.caption: From left, Gabriel LaBelle, Michelle Williams, Paul Dano, Keeley Karsten, Sophia Kopera and Julia Butters as the Fabelmans, fictional versions of Steven Spielberg’s family.
multimedia.copyright: Merie Weismiller Wallace/Universal Pictures and Amblin Entertainment

results.title: SAG Award Nominations 2023: The Complete List, Snubs and Surprises
results.abstract: “The Banshees of Inisherin” and “Everything Everywhere All at Once” pick up important nods. Michelle Williams is shut out.

multimedia.caption: The SAG Awards will be handed out on Feb. 26.
The SAG Awards will be handed out on Feb. 26.
The SAG Awards will be handed out on Feb. 26.

results.title: ‘M3gan’ Beats Box Office Predictions, Sailing Into Second Place
results.abstract: The $12 million PG-13 horror film brought in $30.2 million in ticket sales, behind “Avatar: The Way of Water,” with $45 million.

multimedia.caption: In its first weekend, “M3gan” brought in 30 percent more than box office analysts had predicted.
In its first weekend, “M3gan” brought in 30 percent more than box office analysts had predicted.
In its first weekend, “M3gan” brought in 30 percent more than box office analysts had predicted.

results.title: In ‘Black Panther: Wakanda Forever,’ One Scene Celebrates and Commemorates
results.abstract: Grieving Chadwick Boseman’s death, the “Black Panther” creative team transferred fragments of their sorrow onto a signature funeral sequence.

results.title: Meet the Newer, Bolder Michelle Williams
results.abstract: With “The Fabelmans,” the Oscar-nominated actress moves from minor-key naturalism to more stylized performances: “I wanted to make work that an audience member had to deal with.”

multimedia.caption: “I’ve been working as hard as I know how to make myself ready for a moment when I would meet a role like this,” Michelle Williams said of her performance as Mitzi in “The Fabelmans.”
multimedia.copyright: Sinna Nasseri for The New York Times

multimedia.caption: “I’ve been working as hard as I know how to make myself ready for a moment when I would meet a role like this,” Michelle Williams said of her performance as Mitzi in “The Fabelmans.”
multimedia.copyright: Sinna Nasseri for The New York Times

results.title: Several Golden Globe winners were not there to pick up their awards.
results.abstract: While some could not attend, citing conflicts, Kevin Costner was kept from the ceremony by the severe weather in California.

multimedia.caption: Kevin Costner was prevented from picking up his award for “Yellowstone” because of the storms in California.
Kevin Costner was prevented from picking up his award for “Yellowstone” because of the storms in California.
Kevin Costner was prevented from picking up his award for “Yellowstone” because of the storms in California.

results.title: Eddie Murphy receives the Cecil B. DeMille Award.
results.abstract: The award was given to Murphy, 61, for “outstanding contributions to the world of entertainment.”

multimedia.caption: Eddie Murphy accepting the Globe for his “outstanding contributions to the world of entertainment.”
Eddie Murphy accepting the Globe for his “outstanding contributions to the world of entertainment.”
Eddie Murphy accepting the Globe for his “outstanding contributions to the world of entertainment.”

results.title: Jennifer Coolidge Credits ‘White Lotus’ Creator for a ‘New Beginning’
results.abstract: Accepting a Golden Globe for her role as a needy heiress in the HBO dramedy, Coolidge delivered one of the most memorable speeches of the night.

multimedia.caption: Jennifer Coolidge won for her role in “The White Lotus.”
Jennifer Coolidge won for her role in “The White Lotus.”
Jennifer Coolidge won for her role in “The White Lotus.”

results.title: Michelle Yeoh wins her first Globe.
results.abstract: The actress won her first Golden Globe for her performance in “Everything Everywhere All at Once.” “It’s been an amazing journey, an incredible fight to be here today.”

multimedia.caption: Michelle Yeoh accepting the trophy.
Michelle Yeoh accepting the trophy.
Michelle Yeoh accepting the trophy.

results.title: Ke Huy Quan’s emotional journey.
results.abstract: The former child actor, now 51 and a star of “Everything Everywhere All at Once,” has been winning fans all awards season long.

multimedia.caption: Ke Huy Quan with his Golden Globe for best supporting actor.
Ke Huy Quan with his Golden Globe for best supporting actor.
Ke Huy Quan with his Golden Globe for best supporting actor.

results.title: Jerrod Carmichael quickly addresses the elephant in the room.
results.abstract: Noting that the group that gives out the Golden Globes had no Black members until recently, Jerrod Carmichael, the show’s host, said: “I’ll tell you why I’m here. I’m here ’cause I’m Black.”

multimedia.caption: Jerrod Carmichael addressing the crowd during his monologue.
Jerrod Carmichael addressing the crowd during his monologue.
Jerrod Carmichael addressing the crowd during his monologue.

results.title: Vatican Pledges to Look Into 1983 Disappearance of a Teenage Girl
results.abstract: Vatican officials said they would reopen a cold case that has gripped Italians, spawned countless theories and been the subject of a Netflix documentary series.

multimedia.caption: Pietro Orlandi, the brother of Emanuela Orlandi, a teenager who disappeared in 1983, stands with supporters, family and friends during a sit-in in 2020 in St. Peter’s Square. Their banner reads: “No state, or church can justify criminality. Truth for Emanuela Orlandi.”

Pietro Orlandi, the brother of Emanuela Orlandi, a teenager who disappeared in 1983, stands with supporters, family and friends during a sit-in in 2020 in St. Peter’s Square. Their banner reads: “No state, or church can justify criminality. Truth for Emanuela Orlandi.”

Pietro Orlandi, the brother of Emanuela Orlandi, a teenager who disappeared in 1983, stands with supporters, family and friends during a sit-in in 2020 in St. Peter’s Square. Their banner reads: “No state, or church can justify criminality. Truth for Emanuela Orlandi.”

results.title: The Golden Globes Are Back. Will the Celebrities Be?
results.abstract: At a film gala organized by the National Board of Review, filmmakers discussed the embattled awards show.

results.title: Ruggero Deodato, Whose ‘Cannibal Holocaust’ Enraged, Dies at 83
results.abstract: He directed a variety of movies in a variety of genres. But it was a gruesome found-footage film that brought him both fame and infamy.

multimedia.caption: The director Ruggero Deodato, best known for his shocking 1980 film “Cannibal Holocaust,” occasionally appeared in other directors’ movies. He is seen here in Eli Roth’s “Hostel: Part II” (2007).
The director Ruggero Deodato, best known for his shocking 1980 film “Cannibal Holocaust,” occasionally appeared in other directors’ movies. He is seen here in Eli Roth’s “Hostel: Part II” (2007).
The director Ruggero Deodato, best known for his shocking 1980 film “Cannibal Holocaust,” occasionally appeared in other directors’ movies. He is seen here in Eli Roth’s “Hostel: Part II” (2007).

results.title: Longtime Film Forum Director to Step Down After 50 Years
results.abstract: Karen Cooper, who took over the nonprofit cinema in 1972 and transformed it into a $6 million-a-year operation, will step down in July after five decades.

multimedia.caption: Karen Cooper, left, will step down as director of Film Forum in June. Succeeding her will be Sonya Chung, right.
multimedia.copyright: Left: Henny Garfunkel. Right: Robin Holland

results.title: The Golden Globes: How to Watch the Show’s Rehabilitation Attempt
results.abstract: The group that puts on the ceremony has promised reforms since it plunged into scandal two years ago. On Tuesday, it will try to win back viewers.
des_facet: Monster: The Jeffrey Dahmer Story (TV Program)

multimedia.caption: The Golden Globe Awards will be handed out on Tuesday. Last year’s ceremony was not televised.
The Golden Globe Awards will be handed out on Tuesday. Last year’s ceremony was not televised.

results.title: Michael Snow, Prolific and Playful Artistic Polymath, Is Dead at 94
results.abstract: He was a painter, a musician, a photographer and a sculptor. But he was best known for experimental (and often contentious) films like “Wavelength.”

multimedia.caption: The artist Michael Snow in an undated photo, framed by an image of the Walking Woman, which was his trademark for much of the 1960s.
multimedia.copyright: Mike Slaughter/Toronto Star, via Getty Images

results.title: Movie Trailers Keep Tweaking Well-Known Songs. The Tactic Is Working.
results.abstract: Composers are increasingly in demand for trailerization — reworking existing tracks by artists including Kate Bush, Nirvana and Kendrick Lamar to maximize their impact in film and TV previews.

multimedia.caption: David James Rosen got a job at a production company that specializes in trailers in 2014. Three years later, he helped start Totem, which creates custom music and song overhauls.

results.title: Raúl Castillo Can Empathize With Ambivalence
results.abstract: In “The Inspection,” he plays a drill instructor who takes a bullied recruit under his wing, the kind of nurturing the actor says he has benefited from as well.
